p: Hypericum perforatum L. (St. Johnâ€™s wort), a prominent perennial medicinal herb, has been widely used in the treatment of mild-to-moderate depression (Gaster and Holroyd 2000) and as a potential source for anticancer and antiviral medicines (Schempp et al. 2002; Pasqua et al. 2003). Melatonin is present in Hypericum perforatum L. (Murch et al. 1997; Murch and Saxena 2006), but its daily localization, possible role, and regulation mechanism remain largely unknown.
